The rooms have lots of wonderful modern amenities - theyâ€™re well lit, come with a coffee machine, kettle, and mini-fridge. Air conditioning is quiet and work very well. The bathrooms are similarly modern with a rain shower, and excellent water pressure and temperature. The internet is fast and reliable. The beds are quite hard, especially by European standards. Whether this is a positive or negative is up to you. Room noise varies dramatically from room to room. The windows arenâ€™t well-sealed, especially the rooms with the balcony doors. If youâ€™re in a room facing the main road youâ€™ll hear traffic and especially motorbikes whizzing past constantly, and itâ€™s quite loud. Youâ€™d have to be an especially deep sleeper to not be awoken by the 4am prayers. If they double/triple glazed the windows and got modern well-sealed frames, it would dramatically improve the situation. The rooms facing the pool and without a balcony, are significantly better. Noise is the main reason for my low rating. I imagine locals and those from Muslim countries are used to the noisy prayers, but to medium/light sleepers, the lack of noise insulation is a deal-breaker. A secondary reason is that I prefer a medium bed, this one was hard to the point of being uncomfortable. The hotel is clean, open, and inviting. There are 3 pools: for toddlers, children, and for experienced swimmers. Theyâ€™re clean and kept in immaculate condition. There is a kids club too. Breakfast is subpar. They have a selection of western breakfast (eggs, sausages, baked beans), and some local cuisine. Their noodle soup is nice, but everything else is bland or not very pleasant. Their coffee isnâ€™t good either, which is disappointing considering the richness of coffee culture the country has. That said they have a dim sum restaurant (not included in the price), which is excellent. If you have the option, I recommend not paying for the included breakfast and going to Jing Paradise instead. Finally, the service and staff are excellent. They were kind enough to speak to me in English, and all spoke very well. They even remembered my name at breakfast despite the fact that Iâ€™m quite low-key and quiet. When I asked if they could possibly move me to a quieter room, they were more than happy to oblige and were even kind enough to upgrade me to a pool-view room at no cost. The staff left a warm and wonderful impression on me and I am grateful to them for it.
